intro: Lepistemonopsis volkensii, commonly known as the East African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
